company_context: Automated lead generation targeting decision-makers in independent restaurants and retailers across Canada, focusing on ownership, operations, finance, and bilingual compliance roles.
usage_instructions: Begin lead generation using Priority 1 queries to target owners and founders with high decision-making power.
Proceed to Priority 2 to capture operations and technology managers influencing daily business decisions in small establishments.
Use Priority 3 queries to reach finance and administrative personnel for budgeting and compliance discussions.
Finish with Priority 4 to identify bilingual decision-makers and those focused on Québec to address language and regulatory considerations.
Filter and outreach leads in manageable daily batches for better engagement and conversion rates.
Regularly update and refine queries to adapt to changes in industry roles and regional market dynamics.

# Restaurants Canada
The voice of foodservice | La voix des services alimentaires
Non-profit Organizations • Toronto, Ontario • 37,784 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

## Posts
**Restaurants Canada** (1d): Yesterday we had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious Osmow’s staff lunch—an extended celebration to congratulate the team on the re-opening of their original Streetsville location, the very spot where the Osmow's journey began over 20 years ago. Cheers to many more years of success! 🎉 👏 [Likes: 26, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (2d): Generations may differ, but they all matter. 51% of Millennials dine out weekly, compared to 35% of Boomers. Gen X spends the most at restaurants, and Gen Z is reshaping discovery through social media. Learn more and stay ahead — Start reading the 2025 Foodservice Facts report here: https://bit.ly/4nOzY0U #FoodserviceFacts2025 #Foodservice #Hospitality #data #consumertrends [Likes: 29, Comments: 0]; **Recipe Unlimited Corporation** (3d 4d Edited): We’re proud to share that our CEO, Frank Hennessey, has been honoured with a Lifetime Achievement Award at this year’s Rotman Alumni Awards. This recognition celebrates Frank’s remarkable leadership, vision, and impact on the Canadian restaurant industry and beyond. Throughout his career, Frank has not only guided Recipe through growth and transformation but has also inspired those around him with his commitment to people, innovation, and community. Congratulations, Frank, on this well-deserved honour! [Likes: 42, Comments: 0]; **Foodservice and Hospitality magazine** (3d): Mark von Schellwitz , Restaurants Canada ’s VP of Western Canada, has announced his retirement after more than 28 years with the organization. https://lnkd.in/gX9zey_F [Likes: 105, Comments: 85]; **Restaurants Canada** (3d): In this episode, we sit down with Chris Elliott , Chief Economist & Vice President, Research at Restaurants Canada, to unpack some of the biggest surprises from 2025: to explore the surprising 2025 sales rebound, how the GST holiday gave operators more than a breather, and why domestic tourism was the quiet hero keeping restaurants busy. Chris takes us behind the numbers—like why alcohol sales are slipping, why solo dining is on the rise, and how his POST strategy (Pricing, Operations, Staffing, Technology) can help operators tackle rising costs head-on. We also dig into the hot topics shaping menus and margins plus the real power of using data to make smarter moves. Most importantly, Chris shares why Foodservice Facts should be every operator’s secret weapon and gives us a peek into what’s ahead in 2026. Listen for: • Why sales are up—but profits aren’t • The hidden cost of ignoring productivity • What’s really changing on Canadian menus • How operators can use data to stay competitive 🎧 Tune in now on Spotify: https://bit.ly/42Yr9JV #MENUUnplugged #podcast #FoodserviceFacts #restaurants #data _____________________ 🎙️MENU Unplugged Podcast is a co-production of Restaurants Canada & Benchmark Sixty Restaurant Services 🎙️This episode sponsored by Groupex Canada [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (4d): Restaurants Canada's 2025 Foodservice Facts report found that 8 in 10 young Canadians have cut back on restaurant spending because of rising living costs. Western Canada VP, Mark von Schellwitz joined CTV Vancouver to talk about what government can do to help Canadians struggling with affordability. Watch the full interview here: https://bit.ly/46KcCCC [Likes: 12, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (5d): It was a big week back in Ottawa for Restaurants Canada as we continued our conversations and lobby work around immigration, temporary foreign workers, removing GST from all food and strengthening the viability of the foodservice sector during this period of economic uncertainty. Our message is gaining traction—conversations with key decision-makers confirm they’re listening to our advocacy on affordability, workforce, and related issues. The response to our FOODISFOOD.CA campaign was very positive and gaining more interest. Additionally, we were able to share important context, real data and information on the use of temporary foreign workers. While this remains a complex issue for our sector, it’s essential we use these programs responsibly and continue to uphold the industry’s integrity and reputation. Read President & CEO, KELLY HIGGINSON 's full update here: https://bit.ly/42JsBje [Likes: 15, Comments: 1]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): 🌍✈️Happy World Tourism Day! This year's theme, "Tourism and Sustainable Transformation," is a call to action for all of us. From coast to coast to coast, tourism is a powerful force that drives our economy, industry, celebrates our culture, and connects us with the world. Our vibrant food scene plays a massive role in this! Every time you dine at a local restaurant, you're not just enjoying a meal, you're supporting a network of local producers, farmers, fishers, and chefs. You're helping to sustain jobs and preserve the unique culinary traditions that define our diverse communities. 💡Fun Fact: The restaurant industry accounts for approximately one third of all tourism-related jobs—making it the largest employer within the tourism sector. #WorldTourismDay #SustainableTourism #ExploreCanada #SupportLocal [Likes: 11, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): Restaurants Canada is deeply concerned about the nationwide strike launched by the Canadian Union of Postal Workers as Canadians and businesses cannot afford continued disruption. Read our full statement here: https://bit.ly/4myFELp [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): The Temporary Foreign Worker Program represents just 3% of the foodservice workforce, but it fills a critical need for rural, remote and tourism communities. Restaurants Canada's KELLY HIGGINSON joined CBC's Ontario Today to discuss the reality of the foodservice industry's workforce needs. Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/46pSTJQ [Likes: 11, Comments: 1]

# Restaurants Canadas Post

Restaurants Canada CEO [KELLY HIGGINSON](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/kelly-higginson-76668a1b?trk=public_post-text) and COO [Tracy Macgregor](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/tjmacgregor?trk=public_post-text) attended an encouraging and informative discussion today at [Canadian Club Toronto](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/the-canadian-club-of-toronto?trk=public_post-text) with her worship, Mayor [Olivia Chow](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/olivia-chow-a7290a189?trk=public_post-text), ahead of the release of the Toronto budget. She spoke about a strong future for Toronto and of the tough choices to get our city back on track. Happy to hear that financial stability includes a commitment to supporting and increasing investment in innovation and economic development for growth. Restaurants feed and nourish communities, bringing vibrancy and creativity to main streets across this city while contributing significantly to the economy.

results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.

Overview:
Flooring Canada is a division of CCA Global Partners, the nation’s largest floor covering cooperative. With more than 550 independent, locally-owned flooring retailers, Flooring Canada’s member stores work hard every day to become the most recommended flooring stores in North America. Flooring Canada’s independent retailers strive to make customers deliriously happy by guiding, advising and finding the right floor to make homes beautiful. We are the flooring store where friends send friends for their new floors. Specialties Fresh thinking and innovative products, featuring the largest selection of hardwood, ceramic, cork, laminate, vinyl, carpet and area rugs., Members of the cooperative benefit from aggressive national and local online marketing strategies.

results.title: Dollarama
results.content:
Overview:
Dollarama was founded by third-generation retailer and Canadian entrepreneur, Larry Rossy. It all started with one store, in Matane, Quebec, in 1992, and quickly grew over the next two decades to become a household name and shopping destination for Canadians from coast to coast. Dollarama today is a recognized Canadian value retailer with well over 1,300 locations, led by Neil Rossy, fourth-generation retailer and member of Dollarama’s founding management team. Dollarama aims to provide customers with a consistent shopping experience and compelling value, offering a broad assortment of general merchandise, consumables and seasonal items. All stores are corporately-owned and operated, and are conveniently located in metropolitan areas, mid-sized cities and small towns. Products are available in individual or multiple units at low, fixed price points.

# Dollarama
N/A
Retail • Mont-Royal, Québec • 106,150 followers • 10,001+ employees

## Overview
Dollarama was founded by third-generation retailer and Canadian entrepreneur, Larry Rossy. It all started with one store, in Matane, Quebec, in 1992, and quickly grew over the next two decades to become a household name and shopping destination for Canadians from coast to coast. Dollarama today is a recognized Canadian value retailer with well over 1,300 locations, led by Neil Rossy, fourth-generation retailer and member of Dollarama’s founding management team. Dollarama aims to provide customers with a consistent shopping experience and compelling value, offering a broad assortment of general merchandise, consumables and seasonal items. All stores are corporately-owned and operated, and are conveniently located in metropolitan areas, mid-sized cities and small towns. Products are available in individual or multiple units at low, fixed price points.

results.title: Timothy Yu - Founder at Kilslaay Restaurant Group
results.content:
Timothy Yu
Founder at Kilslaay Restaurant Group
Vancouver
500 connections, 668 followers


About
I am a recent MBA grad with a dual specialization in Strategy, and Marketing. I achieved my MBA from the Sauder School of Business at UBC – where I was ranked in the top ten of my class – and at IE Business School in Madrid. I undertook the MBA in an effort to augment my creative aptitude with a more quantitative and critical skill set, and to gain a broader understanding of business strategy in general. 

I have a diverse marketing background with experience on both client and agency sides. I started my career working as a copywriter for Cossette Communications, and have since led a variety of cross-functional teams at a number of agencies. 

Most recently I worked for Vancouver startup, Recon Instruments and played a pivotal role in defining the marketing strategy and formulating the online community. 

I have an in-depth knowledge of both traditional and digital marketing platforms for B2C, and specialize in marketing and communication strategy creation for new media.


Experience
Founder
[Kilslaay Restaurant Group](None)  
May 2015 - Present
Vancouver, Canada Area
Kilslaay Restaurant Group operates Koerner's Pub, Loafe Cafe and Cafe MOA.


Education
IE Business School
MBA, Strategic Management & Marketing
2011 - 2012
None

results.content:
Dan Holman
Business Owner | Speaker | Implementer | Retail Mentor | Consultant I Trainer
St Albert, Alberta, Canada
500 connections, 1600 followers


About
Dan has spent more than 30 years in the retail and service industries. Specializing in marketing & business development, inventory planning, operations and customer driven sales management. He is an award-winning business coach with a proven understanding of what it takes to be successful as an entrepreneur. Dan spent 16 years in senior management and ownership roles with multi-store retailers before joining Canadian Retail Solutions as their CEO, Director of Retail Planning. Dan works directly with clients’ coast to coast representing hundreds of retail categories. He is the founder of The Wealthy Retailer™ which began as an educational series delivering a successive in-depth look at key areas for growing and nurturing retail stores to maximize their profit potential.


Experience

results.title: Dollarama
results.content:
Overview:
Dollarama was founded by third-generation retailer and Canadian entrepreneur, Larry Rossy. It all started with one store, in Matane, Quebec, in 1992, and quickly grew over the next two decades to become a household name and shopping destination for Canadians from coast to coast. Dollarama today is a recognized Canadian value retailer with well over 1,300 locations, led by Neil Rossy, fourth-generation retailer and member of Dollarama’s founding management team. Dollarama aims to provide customers with a consistent shopping experience and compelling value, offering a broad assortment of general merchandise, consumables and seasonal items. All stores are corporately-owned and operated, and are conveniently located in metropolitan areas, mid-sized cities and small towns. Products are available in individual or multiple units at low, fixed price points.

## Overview
Dollarama was founded by third-generation retailer and Canadian entrepreneur, Larry Rossy. It all started with one store, in Matane, Quebec, in 1992, and quickly grew over the next two decades to become a household name and shopping destination for Canadians from coast to coast. Dollarama today is a recognized Canadian value retailer with well over 1,300 locations, led by Neil Rossy, fourth-generation retailer and member of Dollarama’s founding management team. Dollarama aims to provide customers with a consistent shopping experience and compelling value, offering a broad assortment of general merchandise, consumables and seasonal items. All stores are corporately-owned and operated, and are conveniently located in metropolitan areas, mid-sized cities and small towns. Products are available in individual or multiple units at low, fixed price points.

results.title: Cary Brandes - 👍 Founder of the RenegadeRetailer & ...
results.content:
Cary Brandes
🤓 Founder of RenegadeRetailer & Cie. 🎙 Founder of ThatCouldBeAPodcast.com (Stay Tuned). 👍 Mental Health Advocate.
Canada
500 connections, 21463 followers


About
I'm a Content Creator, Retail Consultant and Mental Health Advocate who is passionate about sharing life experiences to inspire others. As the founder of RenegadeRetailer, I help businesses navigate the ever evolving Retail landscape, while through RenegadeBigBrain, I openly champion Mental Health advocacy, embracing the gift of being Bipolar. 💡 Retail & Leadership. With a wealth of progressive Leadership and Management experience across North America, I take pride in fostering growth, driving impactful results, and mentoring teams to succeed. 🧠 Mental Health & Authenticity. Believing in the power of storytelling, I use my own journey both in retail leadership and Mental Health to empower others, give a voice to those who feel unheard, and encourage authenticity in all aspects of life. If you're curious to learn more, explore my portfolio and connect with me here: www.linktr.ee/CaryBrandes And as always, Stay Phenomenal 🤩 _______________________________________________________________________ Je suis créateur de contenu, consultant en commerce de détail et militant pour la santé mentale, animé par le désir de partager mes expériences de vie afin d’inspirer les autres. En tant que fondateur de RenegadeRetailer, j’aide les entreprises à naviguer dans un paysage du commerce de détail en constante évolution, tandis qu’avec RenegadeBigBrain, je défends activement la santé mentale en embrassant le cadeau d’être Bipolaire. 💡 Commerce de détail & leadership. Fort d’une expérience progressive en gestion et en leadership à travers l’Amérique du Nord, je suis fier de favoriser la croissance, d’obtenir des résultats significatifs et de guider les équipes vers le succès. 🧠 Santé mentale & authenticité. Convaincu du pouvoir du récit, je partage mon parcour tant dans le leadership en commerce de détail que dans la santé mentale pour inspirer, donner une voix à ceux qui se sentent ignorés et encourager l’authenticité sous toutes ses formes. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus, explorez mon portfolio et contactez-moi ici : www.linktr.ee/CaryBrandes Et comme toujours, Soyez phénoménal 🤩.


Experience
Store Manager • Coach
[The Salvation Army in Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/salvationarmycanada)  
Apr 2024 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada
Continued focus on revitalizing the Leadership Team and boosting Team Member engagement, while optimizing operational processes and efficiencies.Coaching and nurturing the Company culture and vision, all while driving store performance through strategic support and talent development initiatives.


Education
N/A

results.title: Ali Asaria - Transformer Lab
results.content:
Ali Asaria
Co-founder of Transformer Lab
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
500 connections, 9280 followers


About
Ali Asaria is a Canadian technology entrepreneur who graduated from Computer Engineering at the University of Waterloo. He is the original creator of the most popular BlackBerry game called BrickBreaker. Today, his work and research is centred around the pursuit of human-like intelligence (AGI) in computers as a path to understanding how our minds work.

Ali has founded several companies valued above $100M including Well.ca, one of Canada’s largest e-commerce companies, and Tulip, a enterprise retail technology company. Ali has experience leading teams from 0 to 200+ people.

In his career, Ali has raised more than $100M in venture capital. In addition, Ali has strong M&A experience, having led the acquisition of several companies. 

Over the years, Ali has been on multiple private and not-for-profit boards alongside some of the world’s most notable investors at firms including iNovia, Arrowroot, Kleiner Perkins, and Union Square Ventures. He believes that founder support, alongside strong governance and alignment at the highest level is paramount to a board’s success.

Ali is a values-driven leader. His life goal is to make the world a better place by putting others before himself, while embracing genuine curiosity as a path to happiness.


Experience
N/A


Education
University of Waterloo
N/A
1999 - 2005
None

results.title: Michael Noble - Chef/Proprietor at The Nash Restaurant & ...
results.content:
Michael Noble
Chef/Proprietor at The Nash Restaurant & Off Cut Bar
Calgary, Alberta, Canada
500 connections, 894 followers


About
I've worked in all aspects of the culinary profession, from small restaurants to large chains, large and small hotels and also have done a number of consulting jobs either opening new restaurant concepts or overhauling existing ones. My strengths aside from a depth of culinary experience are with people, giving them the knowlege and tools to succeed. I've made a legacy in my career of all the great people who have worked with me and who have gone on to create amazing success for themselves in their own careers. Specialties: NOtaBLE ~ The Restaurant is a full service restaurant which opened in August of 2010. The style of cuisine is "Gourmet Comfort", everything is made in our open kitchen which features a large wood and charcoal burning rotisserie on which you will find succulent aromatic rubbed chickens and a roast feature on every day.


Experience
Chef/Proprietor
[The Nash Restaurant & Off Cut Bar](N/A)  
Nov 2014 - Present
Calgary, Alberta, Canada
My legacy project, combining everything that I've learned in 35+ years in the restaurant industry.This beauty is housed in the former National Hotel, which was opened in July of 1907. The former hotel sat empty for a number of years until I joined forces with interior designer Sarah Ward of Sarah Ward Interiors to create this beautiful room which honours the many decades of history in the neighbourhood of Inglewood. The restaurant consists of the light, airy main dining room which faces into the open kitchen and rotisserie bar and which does a modern take on comforting and satisfying dishes, served in a crisp yet friendly way. The restaurant space includes Off Cut Bar - the somewhat badass, sexy, sultry and yet extremely welcoming area which serves contemporary and classic cocktails along with craft beers, great wines and a menu featuring all secondary cuts of meat, poultry and seafood.One hundred and fifty seats in all, including interesting seating areas and tables made from recovered Canadian prairie barn wood and featuring two community tables situated directly beside the kitchen.


Education
Vancouver Community College
CCFCC Red Seal, Culinary
1979 - 1980
None

With over 25 years of experience in the restaurant industry, I am a co-owner of four successful and diverse dining establishments: Bâton Rouge, Enoteca Monza, Big Rig Kitchen and Brewery and La Belle et La Boeuf. As a co-owner, I am committed to creating a positive and inclusive work environment for my staff, and a welcoming and enjoyable atmosphere for my guests. results.title: Michael Terlecki - Co-owner Restaurant L'Orignal
results.content:
Michael Terlecki
Co-owner Restaurant L'Orignal
Montreal, Quebec, Canada
461 connections, 463 followers


About
As the co-owner of a restaurant that has thrived for over 17 years, I bring extensive experience in hospitality, team building, and leadership. Alongside my sister, we’ve built a successful, customer-focused business where I’ve honed my ability to create memorable dining experiences, identify areas for improvement, and hire key talent that drives our success. I’m known for my quick thinking, problem-solving skills, and ability to stay calm under pressure—qualities that have made me well-liked by both my team and clients. I take pride in creating an environment where everyone feels valued, and I’m deeply committed to continually improving both my business and myself. Outside of my work in hospitality, I’m an aspiring actor with a passion for the craft. When I’m not at the restaurant, I’m an avid golfer, always seeking to improve my game and personal growth. Whether it’s refining the guest experience or perfecting my swing, I’m dedicated to being the best version of myself. Let’s connect if you’re interested in hospitality, leadership, or just want to chat about golf or acting!

From sales to e-commerce to marketing

- Undergraduate degrees in Finance and Accounting

Graduate degree in E-Commerce

## Experience ### Le Club [Le Club](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/leclubcc?trk=public_profile_experience-group-header) N/A - Present Montréal, Québec, Canada ### Specialized Bicycle Components [Specialized Bicycle Components](https://www.linkedin.com/company/specialized-bicycle-components?trk=public_profile_experience-group-header) N/A - Present Montreal, Quebec, Canada ### Bike Division Brand Manager [Lanctot Ltée Distributor](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/lanctot-sports) Apr 2017 - Feb 2018 Montreal, Quebec, Canada - Coordinating implementation of smaller distributor acquisition- Evaluating quotes from brands looking for national distribution- Co-developing national sales strategy for sports eyewear brand ### Produce Inventory Analyst/Buyer [Metro Inc.](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/metro-inc.) Jul 2016 - Apr 2017 Laval, Quebec - Analyzing sales fluctuations and determining optimal replenishment plan for each DC- Initiating purchase orders and ensuring produce respect quality specifications- Identifying issues that impact in-stock/inventory- Resolving aged inventory in the DC's and recommending corrective action ### Team Manager [Lama Cycles inc.](N/A) Oct 2012 - Sep 2016 Montreal, Canada Area - Recruiting, training and managing riders who are great brand ambassadors.- Managing all team sponsors: contracts, press releases, sponsorship proposal- Responsible of the promotion and the visibility we offer to our sponsors.- Managing our relationships with different media platforms and photographers. ### Accounting Clerk [Just For Laughs / Juste pour rire](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/justforlaughs) May 2015 - Apr 2016 Montreal, Canada Area - Participating in the review of and tracking, follow-up and adherence to budgets- Assisting in the recording of accounts payable, matching to purchase orders and processing of invoices ### Finance Intern [iF3 International Freeski Film Festival](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/if3-festival-ski-snowboard-mountain-bike) Nov 2014 - May 2015 Montreal, Canada Area ### East Area Finance Coordinator [PepsiCo](https://www.linkedin.com/company/pepsico) May 2014 - Sep 2014 Laval, Canada - Analyzing sales and cost of goods sold for the finance and sales departments to communicate the results on a weekly basis.- Improving existing spreadsheets to increase reading of analysis and decision-making.- Redesigning financial incentives program to improve sales growth. ### Marketing/Social Network Manager [Maaxx Events](N/A) Nov 2011 - Dec 2012 Montreal, Canada Area - Responsible for managing its brand image on different web medias as well as social networks.- Promoting events on different websites related to the mountain biking scene. ### Daily Operations Department (National Bank Securities) [National Bank of Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/banquenationaleducanada) Jun 2011 - Sep 2011 Montreal, Canada Area - Verifying banking transactions related to REEE and REER accounts and authorized in branches.- Using GB Fonds software in order to correct any mistaken transaction that occurred during the day. ### Sales Associate [Oberson](N/A) Oct 2010 - Jun 2011 Montreal, Canada Area - Analyzing the type of skiing/biking that a client practices in order to come up with a ski/bike that is suitable for him and appropriated according to his competences.- Attending ski/bike manufacturers’ clinics in order to promote adequately their range of products available in store. ## Education ### HEC Montréal Specialized Graduate Diploma (DESS), E-Commerce/Electronic Commerce 2020 - 2022 None ### HEC Montréal Certificate, Accounting 2015 - 2016 None ### UQAM School of Management Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Finance 2011 - 2014 None ### Collège Jean-de-Brébeuf (collégial) Diploma of College Studies, Human Science 2008 - # Retail Council of Canada
Empowering small, mid & large retailers in Canada through representation, communication and education #RetailMatters🍁
Industry Associations • Toronto • 30,430 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Retail Council of Canada (RCC) is a not-for-profit association representing small, mid, and large retail businesses in every community across the country. ## Posts
**Retail Council of Canada** (1d): The Canadian retail sector employed 2.3 million people - essentially flat month over month but continuing the gains seen since the first quarter of 2025. Part-time employment fell 5% from June and has been on a steady decline since May, likely tied to the nationwide closure of Hudson’s Bay. Youth employment remains a concern, with fewer temporary positions available between May and August than in previous years. 💡 For full insights and updated data, check out RCC's Member-only Retail Pulse Dashboard. https://hubs.ly/Q03D8zJJ0 [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Retail Council of Canada** (1d Edited): 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲: 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗦𝗲𝗽𝘁. 𝟭, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱, 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿-𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗖𝗨𝗦𝗠𝗔 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗨.𝗦. 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲𝗿 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱𝘀, while tariffs remain in place on steel, aluminum, and autos. RCC welcomes this step as a move toward easing costs for consumers and retailers, and we hope it paves the way for a more stable and predictable trade relationship with the U.S. Going forward, clarity will be essential, as the changes also introduce added complexity and administrative burden for retailers. results.raw_content:
### Manager, Independent Retail Operations

[Federated Co-operatives Limited](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/coopfcl?trk=public_jobs_sub-nav-cta-optional-url "Federated Co-operatives Limited") Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada

# Manager, Independent Retail Operations

#### [Federated Co-operatives Limited](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/coopfcl?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada 2 weeks ago [See who Federated Co-operatives Limited has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D1392680%26title%3DRetail%2BOperations%2BManager&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fmanager-independent-retail-operations-at-federated-co-operatives-limited-4304597412&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

Federated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) is hiring a Manager, Independent Retail Operations on a permanent basis on our Consumer Products team. This position is a hybrid opportunity and can be based anywhere in Western Canada. This position requires extensive travel within Western Canada up to 30%.

This role provides strategic leadership to Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations teams across Western Canada, driving profitability, operational excellence, and brand alignment. By fostering consultative sales and supporting independent retailers, you’ll lead initiatives that grow business, enhance community impact, and strengthen The Grocery People (TGP) brand through innovative programs, promotions, and training.

**What you’ll do:**

* Lead and develop a high-performing team of Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations Managers to drive growth and sustainability in independent retail.
* Support strategic business planning by guiding financial analysis, performance evaluation, and opportunity prioritization for both independent and corporate locations.
* Oversee program development and rollout, ensuring tools, promotions, and standards align with operational realities and deliver measurable results.
* Foster strong client relationships through direct engagement, providing consultative support and promoting TGP programs and retail best practices.
* Drive operational excellence by setting performance standards, mentoring teams, and ensuring compliance with brand, safety, and execution expectations.

**Who you’ll work with:**

**The Team:** You will work closely with other Operations Managers, will have a team of Senior Retail Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations Managers reporting into you, and will report into the Director, Independent Business. This team strives to cultivate a culture that is collaborative, results-oriented, and client centric.

**The Customers:** You will demonstrate customer focus and business acumen while supporting our TGP retails.

**Why it matters:**

We help feed Western Canada by providing fresh groceries and wholesale solutions to independent retail stores, restaurants and other food establishments in communities large and small.

**Who you are:**

You are looking for a career in Retail Operations Advisory and:

* Have 8+ years of relevant progressively responsible experience in the grocery or food wholesale/retail industry. Must have demonstrated experiencing leading or developing teams. Experience working with independent retail grocers would be considered an asset.
* Have a bachelor’s degree in commerce/business (a combination of relevant education and experience may be considered).

**What we offer:**

* Competitive salaries, short-term incentives, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan.
* Encouragement to take advantage of learning opportunities to grow and develop as a Team Member.
* As a co-operative, we do business differently. We believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and what we offer, visit www.fcl.crs.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to ensure an enjoyable candidate experience. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we invite you to submit your requests to us via fclhr@fcl.crs. All information received will be kept confidential.

If this opportunity speaks to you, we invite you to apply by October 8, 2025.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

As this position is considered a position of trust and safety sensitive, you may be required to complete criminal record check, drug & alcohol test, and driver’s abstract in accordance with FCL policies.

***FCL embraces diversity and inclusion. We’re working to create a workforce that is as diverse as the communities we serve and an environment where every team member brings their whole self to work. We believe all candidates should feel at home with us and be given the opportunity to fully participate during the recruitment process.***

* ### Seniority level

   Mid-Senior level
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Finance and Training
* ### Industries

   Retail, Financial Services, and Food and Beverage Retail

results.title: Ben Sachse - Operations and Finance Manager
results.content:
Ben Sachse
Operations and Finance Manager
Elora, Ontario, Canada
414 connections, 416 followers


About
"There is an intersection between the human experience, food, and design, that allows for endless exploration and possibilities. " As a confident Chef, and recently Project Manager, I am keenly aware of the importance of the connection between the mechanics and systems of any organization, and the workforce for which, and because of which, it exists. Hospitality is an industry that offers boundless opportunities for making the world a better place. I have a proven track record of delivering effective management systems for my employers and personal ventures. My 16 years in the Hospitality Industry, as Chef, Restaurant Owner, and Hospitality Group Project Manager, has offered me insight and experiences that go beyond traditional F&B roles. I have been integral in the creation of vibrant, energetic hospitality businesses in Elora and St Jacobs. (see The Elora Brewing Company, The Butcher&The Market) In 2020, I took on a roll as Project Manager for a growing Hospitality company, the Fat Sparrow Group, embracing a role quite new. I have taken a headlong dive into Construction Project management, Inventory and Procurement, Control and reporting, Cost of Good management, and Procedures Development. A more detailed background: Born in Switzerland, I immigrated to Canada at the age of 10, growing up in the peace and solitude of small town Ontario. I studied Anthropology and Archeology at University, and later found my passion at the Stratford Chef School, graduating with Honours in 2008. I spent a year experiencing life as an apprentice at an isolated Restaurant near Osaka, Japan, and after returning to Canada, I was ultimately drawn to settle in Elora when in 2011 I was offered my first position as a head Chef.


Experience
Director of Finance And Operations
[The Bruce Hotel - Stratford Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/the-bruce-hotel---stratford-canada)  
Feb 2025 - Present
Stratford, Ontario, Canada



Education
Stratford Chef School
Honours, Classic French Cookery
2006 - 2008
None

# Ben Sachse **Operations and Finance Manager** Elora, Ontario, Canada, CA 414 connections, 416 followers ## About "There is an intersection between the human experience, food, and design, that allows for endless exploration and possibilities

" As a confident Chef, and recently Project Manager, I am keenly aware of the importance of the connection between the mechanics and systems of any organization, and the workforce for which, and because of which, it exists

Hospitality is an industry that offers boundless opportunities for making the world a better place

I have a proven track record of delivering effective management systems for my employers and personal ventures

My 16 years in the Hospitality Industry, as Chef, Restaurant Owner, and Hospitality Group Project Manager, has offered me insight and experiences that go beyond traditional F&B roles

I have been integral in the creation of vibrant, energetic hospitality businesses in Elora and St Jacobs

(see The Elora Brewing Company, The Butcher&The Market) In 2020, I took on a roll as Project Manager for a growing Hospitality company, the Fat Sparrow Group, embracing a role quite new

I have taken a headlong dive into Construction Project management, Inventory and Procurement, Control and reporting, Cost of Good management, and Procedures Development

A more detailed background: Born in Switzerland, I immigrated to Canada at the age of 10, growing up in the peace and solitude of small town Ontario

I studied Anthropology and Archeology at University, and later found my passion at the Stratford Chef School, graduating with Honours in 2008

I spent a year experiencing life as an apprentice at an isolated Restaurant near Osaka, Japan, and after returning to Canada, I was ultimately drawn to settle in Elora when in 2011 I was offered my first position as a head Chef

## Experience ### Director of Finance And Operations [The Bruce Hotel - Stratford Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/the-bruce-hotel---stratford-canada) Feb 2025 - Present Stratford, Ontario, Canada ### Project & Inventory Manager [The Stonecrock Inc](N/A) Jul 2020 - Jan 2025 St. Jacobs, Ontario, Canada PM'd Conversion/Construction of a small-town legacy business into a vibrant modern new venture. I controlled all steps from Design, costing, permitting, and completion, up to and including directing initial internal operating systems and inventory management. ### Kitchen corp owner / head chef [Elora Brewing Company](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/elora-brewing-company) Mar 2015 - Aug 2020 Elora, Ontario, Canada Leader of incredible group of skilled cooks, occasional boss, do-er of dishes, constantly learning and reinventing the wheel... ### Executive Chef [Cork Restaurant](N/A) Sep 2011 - Jan 2014 Elora, Ontario Cork restaurant was a small Wine-bar and Classic Bistro, inspired by the amazing abundance of local farmers and producers in the Centre-Wellington area. I hired and trained kitchen staff, created menus, and designed the spreadsheets and control mechanisms necessary to ensure quality control, proper food costing, inventory control, ordering lists, and the daily nitty-gritty guidelines and checklists. ### Chef de Cuisine [Wills & Co](N/A) Oct 2010 - Sep 2011 N/A Designed and executed Retail and Catering menus in a Canadian-only delicatessen / catering space. Helped bring to fruition the store's inception. Hired and trained all kitchen staff. Planned kitchen layout and organization. ### Entremetier [Stone Road Grille](N/A) Mar 2010 - Oct 2010 N/A Prepped mise-en-place for all main-dish sides for dinner service.Ran Entremetier station during dinner service. ### Apprentice [Del Cook, Osaka Japan](https://jp.linkedin.com/company/del-cook) Mar 2009 - Jan 2010 Nose, Osaka, Japan For 9 months, I had the incredible experience of cooking in the japanese countryside, just one hour's trainride from bustling Osaka city. While the food served was classically french in style and preparation, the exclusively locally grown ingredients and the inspiration they provided, were japanese in all their delightful forms. ### Garde Manger / Saucier [Oviinbyrd](N/A) Mar 2008 - Oct 2008 N/A ## Education ### Stratford Chef School Honours, Classic French Cookery 2006 - 2008 None ### Wilfrid Laurier University Cultural Anthropology 1997 - 2002 None ## Publications N/A ## Honors & Awards N/A ## Certifications Project Management online (WatSPEED at the University of Waterloo); Procore Certified: Project Manager at Owner (Preconstruction) (Procore Technologies) ## Volunteering - once in a while Guest Chef The Hospital for Sick Children Children Once in a while, I have the great honour to be invited to Marnie's lounge to make myself available to any kids wishing to spend an hour or so getting their hands dirty with some form of food. ## Languages **French** (Limited working proficiency), **German** (Native or bilingual proficiency), **English** (Full professional proficiency), **Japanese** (Elementary proficiency) ## Organizations N/A ## Activity - **Yesterday, we officially welcomed tens of thousands of new (very tiny) coworkers — a thriving colony of honey bees! 🐝🌼 As part of our continued…** Liked by Ben Sachse [View Post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/kimberley-kerr-_yesterday-we-officially-welcomed-tens-of-activity-7340747074075844610-On8b) ![Activity Image](https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D4E22AQGChZmBKdxNGQ/feedshare-shrink_2048_1536/B4EZd.SjcoGcA0-/0/1750170483465?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=o_LqcEpGYRkUFMC33bEg7eUf9dBnCq3NA4ffu96-A-Y) - **What does over $800,000 worth of rescued food look like? **Ready to make your next big professional move? Join us on our journey to achieve our big dream of building the most loved restaurant brands in the world.** Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with nearly $45 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 32,000 restaurants in more than 120 countries and territories.RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands – TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES®, and FIREHOUSE SUBS®. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.RBI is committed to growing the TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES® and FIREHOUSE SUBS® brands by leveraging their respective core values, employee and franchisee relationships, and long track records of community support. Each brand benefits from the global scale and shared best practices that come from ownership by Restaurant Brands International Inc.**Position Overview**Reporting to the Sr. Manager, TH CPG Finance, the Manager, TH Finance will be responsible for managing all financial routines including month-end closing and reporting processes, in addition to ad hoc reporting, analyses, and financial modeling. The ideal candidate will have a finance or accounting background and the ability to interpret key financial information. The candidate should be a hands-on team player with excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills. They must have the ability to understand finance & accounting concepts and be able to convey information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.**Responsibilities**

* Lead the monthly closing process for Tim Hortons CPG including commentary and insights on the results
* Lead the monthly forecast process, working with business partners to forecast and drive results
* Lead the annual budget process in collaboration with the CPG business team
* Perform monthly analysis of trade spend, identifying effectiveness of promotional activity and areas for optimization
* Prepare retailer and product level financial reports, highlighting key findings and actionable insights
* Work with Corporate Accounting and Shared Services areas to ensure that results are consistent with U.S. GAAP
* Assist with various ad hoc projects and financial modeling to support business decisions as needed

**Requirements**

* 4+ years of finance or accounting experience
* High degree of comfort with Microsoft Office applications and ERP systems; SAP, OneStream and IBM Planning Analytics experience considered an asset
* Strong organizational skills required to meet tight reporting deadlines
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Undergraduate degree in finance or accounting an asset

Benefits at all of our global offices are focused on physical, mental and financial wellness. We offer unique and progressive benefits, including a comprehensive global paid parental leave program that supports employees as they expand their families, free telemedicine and mental wellness support.Restaurant Brands International and all of its affiliated companies (collectively, RBI) are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers that do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, provincial or federal laws, rules, or regulations. RBI's policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

Direct message the job poster from Winchesters

[Angie Amin](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/angie-amin-3200a71b4) 

### Angie Amin

#### Recruitment Consultant at Winchesters | Finance & Accounting

**Finance Manager**

**Toronto, ON · Full-time**

**On-site (Downtown Toronto)**

**About the job**

**Manager, Finance – Real Estate**

**Toronto, ON – On-site (5 days per week)**

**$120K – $135K base + bonus + benefits**

Our client, a **leading global real estate investment and asset-management organization**, is seeking a Finance Manager to join its corporate finance team in downtown Toronto. This role will oversee financial reporting, investment operations, and debt management across a diverse North American real-estate portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a **CPA-designated finance professional** with strong technical accounting expertise, a solid understanding of IFRS and US GAAP, and proven experience leading finance teams within complex, multi-entity environments. This is a rare opportunity to join a best-in-class organization known for excellence, collaboration, and long-term career growth.

**Responsibilities**

* Oversee **financial reporting, planning, forecasting, and audit processes** for investment entities.
* Manage the **onboarding and offboarding of investments**, including fund flow, loan agreements, and purchase-price allocations.
* Prepare **valuation materials, board packages, and investor reports** analyzing key return metrics (IRR, MOC, TWR).
* Lead **debt-management and compliance activities**, supporting financing, refinancing, and acquisitions.
* Supervise and mentor a **team of 3 + finance professionals**, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and professional growth.
* Maintain **intercompany reconciliations** and strengthen internal controls.
* Partner cross-functionally with **tax, asset-management, and capital-markets** teams to optimize performance and reporting.

**Requirements**

* CPA designation (CPA, CA preferred).
* 8 + years of progressive accounting and finance experience, ideally with exposure to **real estate or capital-markets**.
* Strong technical knowledge of **IFRS, US GAAP, and consolidations**.
* Advanced Excel proficiency; experience with **Yardi, OneStream, or similar** systems is an asset.
* Demonstrated experience **managing and developing finance teams**.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills with a high attention to detail.

If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please apply!.

Due to the volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

results.content:
Overview:
Build your career with a fast-growing, Canadian-owned company. A&W Food Services of Canada is a Canadian company with over $1.6 billion in sales and more than 1,020 franchised restaurants across the country. Through a steadfast commitment to collaborative working relationships and strategy, A&W has repeatedly earned recognition as a highly successful business and has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed companies. A&W is an industry leader in developing a highly productive and cooperative work environment using a set of guidelines we call 'Climate Goals'. These Climate Goals have been integral in creating the open, candid, results-focused workplace we enjoy today. Our Climate Goals: Every day I bring my best to my work and my team. I build a safe environment by welcoming, accepting and respecting everyone in our community. We hustle to delight each guest with the convenience they crave. We earn the trust of our guests and each other by always doing what’s right. I embrace change and welcome the future with creativity and courage. We work together as partners pursuing common goals and shared success. We listen to understand each other. I invite, share and act on feedback to continuously learn and improve. I recognize, celebrate and take pride in our big and small wins.

## Overview
Build your career with a fast-growing, Canadian-owned company. A&W Food Services of Canada is a Canadian company with over $1.6 billion in sales and more than 1,020 franchised restaurants across the country. Through a steadfast commitment to collaborative working relationships and strategy, A&W has repeatedly earned recognition as a highly successful business and has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed companies. A&W is an industry leader in developing a highly productive and cooperative work environment using a set of guidelines we call 'Climate Goals'. These Climate Goals have been integral in creating the open, candid, results-focused workplace we enjoy today. Our Climate Goals: Every day I bring my best to my work and my team. I build a safe environment by welcoming, accepting and respecting everyone in our community. We hustle to delight each guest with the convenience they crave. We earn the trust of our guests and each other by always doing what’s right. I embrace change and welcome the future with creativity and courage. **A&W Food Services of Canada Inc.** (3d 3d): 🍔 😋 Hope You're Hungry!😋 🍔 Tomorrow, August 21st, is A&W's annual Burgers to Beat MS Day! With every Teen Burger® purchased, A&W donates $2 to MS Canada to fund vital research and support programs for all Canadians affected by MS. What an easy (and delicious) way to help all 90,000+ Canadians living with multiple sclerosis! We can't wait to see you at your local A&W restaurant. You might even want to visit a few in your area to check out the special fundraising activities our amazing franchisees have planned for the day! There is always room for another Teen Burger®... #BurgersToBeatMS #MultipleSclerosis #MS [Likes: 39, Comments: 2]; **A&W Food Services of Canada Inc.** (1w): 🍁 Bringing Burgers to Beat MS Back Home to Saskatchewan with JUNO-Award Winning Canadian Country Star Jess Moskaluke! 🍁 What an incredible full-circle moment! On August 7th, we were thrilled to bring the Burgers to Beat MS campaign back to its roots in Saskatoon for a special meet-and-greet with multi-platinum Canadian country music artist, Jess Moskaluke. The very first Burgers to Beat MS Day was held right here in Saskatchewan back in 2008, and the energy at this event was a testament to the community's unwavering support since day one. A huge thank you to everyone who joined us! It was truly inspiring to see so many people from the local community come out to celebrate the history of our campaign and help us raise critical awareness and funds for all Canadians affected by MS. Jess' commitment to our cause has been incredible, and we're so grateful for her partnership. Her willingness to share her personal connection to MS and partner with A&W and MS Canada is a powerful example of using one's platform for good. This event was a perfect lead-in to this year's official Burgers to Beat MS Day on 🙌 August 21 🙌 . Don't forget to visit any A&W Canada location and help us continue this amazing tradition! Chez A&W, en tant que fiers membres de l'Association canadienne de la franchise et du World Franchise Council, nous sommes ravis de célébrer cette initiative développée ici même au Canada! La Journée mondiale de la franchise vise à reconnaître les contributions incroyables des franchisés en tant que propriétaires de petites entreprises. Elle vise également à mettre en lumière l'immense impact économique et communautaire du franchisage dans le monde entier. Jetez un coup d'œil à la courte vidéo ci-dessous dans laquelle certains de nos dirigeants et franchisés dévoués partagent ce qu'ils aiment le plus à propos du franchisage! Laissez un commentaire ci-dessous et dites-nous ce que vous aimez le plus à propos du franchisage, nous vous encourageons à vous exprimer! [Likes: 89, Comments: 2]; **A&W Food Services of Canada Inc.** (2mo): 🧡 Do you have a passion for print? 🎨 We’re looking for a Brand Packaging & Print Services Coordinator! This position requires exceptional organizational skill and a customer service focus, and works closely with A&W suppliers and operators. If you’re interested in bringing A&W’s marketing to life through POS, menuboards, and coupons, you can find more information here: https://lnkd.in/g4wvG-iz ------------- 🧡 Vous êtes passionné par l'imprimerie ? 🎨 Nous recherchons un Coordonnateur, Emballages de marque et services d’impression ! Ce poste exige des compétences organisationnelles exceptionnelles et un sens aigu du service à la clientèle. Le titulaire travaille en étroite collaboration avec les fournisseurs et les opérateurs A&W. Si vous souhaitez donner vie au marketing d'A&W à travers les points de vente, les menus et les coupons, vous trouverez plus d'informations ici : https://lnkd.in/g4wvG-iz [Likes: 51, Comments: 10]

results.content:
Kevin Morrison
Helping independent restaurant owners manage prime cost & realize 15%-20% profits.
Denver, Colorado, United States
500 connections, 2749 followers


About
A bit about me From college (plural) dropout to successful restaurateur, I have navigated the challenging restaurant industry, ultimately establishing a multi-concept, multi-unit restaurant company that gained national recognition. My Mexican concept, Tacos Tequila Whiskey, was honored by Bon Appetit Magazine as one of the Top 50 New Restaurants in the United States and recognized as a Breakout Brand by Nation’s Restaurant News. My first venture, Spicy Pickle Sub Shop, earned a spot in Nation’s Restaurant News Hot Concept awards and later transitioned into a franchising brand, which I departed when the company went public. With over four decades in the hospitality industry, and more than 30 years as a chef and entrepreneur, I have built a portfolio of restaurants ranging from fast-casual sandwich shops to a higher-end wood-fired seafood restaurant and oyster house. My passion for the independent restaurant industry has led me to launch Butter Hospitality, where I have the privilege of working with the next generation of independent restaurant owners. Butter Hospitality supports restaurant operators at every stage of the journey. From pre-opening the first location to scaling to multi units. Through my innovative “new mindset” coaching program, the focus is building the restaurant foundation by implementing proven systems. These systems are used by my management team in my restaurants to this day…. Because they work!


Experience
Title? I'm just trying to run a few restaurants, and coach the next generation of owners.

### Manager, Independent Retail Operations

[Federated Co-operatives Limited](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/coopfcl?trk=public_jobs_sub-nav-cta-optional-url "Federated Co-operatives Limited") Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada

# Manager, Independent Retail Operations

#### [Federated Co-operatives Limited](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/coopfcl?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada 2 weeks ago [See who Federated Co-operatives Limited has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D1392680%26title%3DRetail%2BOperations%2BManager&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fmanager-independent-retail-operations-at-federated-co-operatives-limited-4304597412&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

Federated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) is hiring a Manager, Independent Retail Operations on a permanent basis on our Consumer Products team. This position is a hybrid opportunity and can be based anywhere in Western Canada. This position requires extensive travel within Western Canada up to 30%.

This role provides strategic leadership to Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations teams across Western Canada, driving profitability, operational excellence, and brand alignment. By fostering consultative sales and supporting independent retailers, you’ll lead initiatives that grow business, enhance community impact, and strengthen The Grocery People (TGP) brand through innovative programs, promotions, and training.

**What you’ll do:**

* Lead and develop a high-performing team of Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations Managers to drive growth and sustainability in independent retail.
* Support strategic business planning by guiding financial analysis, performance evaluation, and opportunity prioritization for both independent and corporate locations.
* Oversee program development and rollout, ensuring tools, promotions, and standards align with operational realities and deliver measurable results.
* Foster strong client relationships through direct engagement, providing consultative support and promoting TGP programs and retail best practices.
* Drive operational excellence by setting performance standards, mentoring teams, and ensuring compliance with brand, safety, and execution expectations.

**Who you’ll work with:**

**The Team:** You will work closely with other Operations Managers, will have a team of Senior Retail Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations Managers reporting into you, and will report into the Director, Independent Business. This team strives to cultivate a culture that is collaborative, results-oriented, and client centric.

**The Customers:** You will demonstrate customer focus and business acumen while supporting our TGP retails.

**Why it matters:**

We help feed Western Canada by providing fresh groceries and wholesale solutions to independent retail stores, restaurants and other food establishments in communities large and small.

**Who you are:**

You are looking for a career in Retail Operations Advisory and:

* Have 8+ years of relevant progressively responsible experience in the grocery or food wholesale/retail industry. Must have demonstrated experiencing leading or developing teams. Experience working with independent retail grocers would be considered an asset.
* Have a bachelor’s degree in commerce/business (a combination of relevant education and experience may be considered).

**What we offer:**

* Competitive salaries, short-term incentives, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan.
* Encouragement to take advantage of learning opportunities to grow and develop as a Team Member.
* As a co-operative, we do business differently. We believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and what we offer, visit www.fcl.crs.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to ensure an enjoyable candidate experience. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we invite you to submit your requests to us via fclhr@fcl.crs. All information received will be kept confidential.

If this opportunity speaks to you, we invite you to apply by October 8, 2025.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

As this position is considered a position of trust and safety sensitive, you may be required to complete criminal record check, drug & alcohol test, and driver’s abstract in accordance with FCL policies.

***FCL embraces diversity and inclusion. We’re working to create a workforce that is as diverse as the communities we serve and an environment where every team member brings their whole self to work. We believe all candidates should feel at home with us and be given the opportunity to fully participate during the recruitment process.***

* ### Seniority level

   Mid-Senior level
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Finance and Training
* ### Industries

   Retail, Financial Services, and Food and Beverage Retail

Referrals increase your chances of interviewing at Federated Co-operatives Limited by 2x

## Posts
**Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (1w 1w): Excited to be partnering with #RadicleFemmes to empower, celebrate & advance women in weed. Come out and let’s connect at an event near you! Janani Nadesananthan Amanda Wright Alex Richardson Sierra Koitses Rhiannon Galloway [Likes: 8, Comments: 0]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (1w 1w Edited): Check out Breadstack ’s “State of Cannabis Tech” Report for new industry benchmarks & insights from the voice of retailers across Canada! [Likes: 1, Comments: 0]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (3w): Our Collective of Ontario & Alberta Independent Retailers are clear: One Voice. One Mission. The time is now to: 💡 Unlock revenue. 🛑 Remove outdated rules. ⚖️ Enforce fairness. This isn’t just regional frustration, it’s a national mandate. Let’s turn insight into action. Your Voice. Your Priorities. Our Mission. #CannabisRetailRights #IRCCollective #AdvocacyInAction #IndependentStrong Grant Caton Chris Felgate Janani Nadesananthan Sierra Koitses Matthew Tyas Rhiannon Galloway Amanda Wright Alex Richardson [Likes: 13, Comments: 0]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (4w Edited): “Taxed to Death” Ontario Independent Retailers say it’s time for tax reform! Retailers’ margins are gutted by mark-ups, fees and administrative burdens. All while illicit players pay nothing and are a drain on our taxes. Let’s keeps legal retailers alive and customers buying from the legal market. #ProtectLegalRetail #OntarioCannabisRetailers #CannabisRetailRights #IndependentStrong #IRCCollective Your Voice. Your Priorities. Our Mission. Grant Caton Chris Felgate Janani Nadesananthan Sierra Koitses Matthew Tyas Rhiannon Galloway Amanda Wright Alex Richardson [Likes: 8, Comments: 0]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (4w 4w): What a night 🙌 Huge shoutout to Tether for bringing the Alberta cannabis community together in Edmonton. Grateful for the connections & collaboration that keep our industry growing strong! [Likes: 8, Comments: 0]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (1mo Edited): Consumer Clarity = Industry Trust. Without trust, the legal market loses. Our Survey results showed: 📊 Ontario: 93% of Independent Retailers want standardized testing & labelling. 📊 Alberta: 59% of consumers shopping with our Independent Retailers reportedly "don’t understand potency or testing variance". We need national testing protocols and standardized labelling. National clarity means national confidence. Your Voice. Your Priorities. Our Mission. Grant Caton Chris Felgate Janani Nadesananthan Sierra Koitses Matthew Tyas Rhiannon Galloway Amanda Wright Alex Richardson #TestedAndTrusted #SmartLabeling #CannabisRetailRights #IndependentStrong #IRCCollective [Likes: 19, Comments: 2]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (1mo): "Store density is killing independents. Stop the Store Cramming!” Without smart policy, oversaturation will push independents out and hurt communities. Ontario Independent Retailers are calling for: 📏 Buffer zones 📉 Licensing caps We want a vibrant industry, store saturation is driving a race to the bottom. Your Voice. Your Priorities. Our Mission. Grant Caton Chris Felgate Janani Nadesananthan Sierra Koitses Matthew Tyas Rhiannon Galloway Amanda Wright Alex Richardson #OntarioCannabisRetailers #CannabisRetailRights #IndependentStrong #IRCCollective [Likes: 18, Comments: 2]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (1mo): From our recent survey, Alberta Independents warn that illicit websites and unlicensed storefronts are undermining the entire legal market. The 30g possession cap isn’t stopping crime, it’s pushing bulk buyers to the illicit market. Raise the limit. Keep sales in the legal channel and reclaim the customers. Legal cannabis shouldn’t lose to outdated policy. Raise the Limit - Stop Driving Business to the Illicit Market. #AlbertaCannabisRetailers #SupportLegalCannabis #CannabisRetailRights #IndependentStrong #IRCCollective Your Voice. Your Priorities. Our Mission. [Likes: 8, Comments: 0]; **Tether** (1mo Edited): BUDS! Time to get excited & meet the brand lineup for Tether Edmonton... Blunt Botanicals, Freedom Cannabis, Frank CBD, NightNight CBN, DayDay CBG, TYTAN, Happy & Stoned, INVADER & The Goo! by Crop Circle Cannabis , XPLOR, General Admission, Greybeard, Versus , Pearls by Gron, Handy Dandies, Independent Retail Cannabis Collective , Turning Point Brands Canada , Clipper, PAX, RYOT, Honeystick & Zig-Zag. 📅 Wednesday, September 10, 2025 ⏰ 6:00 to 8:00 PM 📍 Bison Lodge What can you expect? Sampling opportunities Product education Food and drinks That signature Tether energy Tickets are moving fast. Get yours here: https://lnkd.in/ehP-bsM7 [Likes: 19, Comments: 1]; **Independent Retail Cannabis Collective** (1mo): Cut the Middleman. Grow the Market. The numbers don’t lie: 📍 Alberta: 97% want direct LP-to-Retail relationships, with 93% saying it will increase revenue. 📍 Ontario: 75% want the same to drive more margin, more marketing and more control. Let LPs and Retailers work together for stronger legal sales. Policy should connect entrepreneurs, not keep them apart. Your Voice. Your Priorities. Our Mission. Grant Caton Chris Felgate Janani Nadesananthan Sierra Koitses Matthew Tyas Rhiannon Galloway Amanda Wright Alex Richardson #CannabisEquity #CannabisRetailRights #IndependentStrong #IRCCollective [Likes: 14, Comments: 0]
